page.title: 13New Forest-Felling Deciduous
page.content:
{<Cont} 4. Any odd shaped pieces are stacked into piles of 8'x4'x4' called a "cord" and are sold at the roadside for Â£20 a cord for use as{firewood.}Odd shaped pieces of softwood are now increasingly being sold as firewood.
An interesting note is that recently 3 New Forest Oak trees of over 35' in straight growth have been selected to be used in rebuilding{York Minster.
{Credits This area was surveyed and written by: Christine Corn - Teacher David Corn - Teacher Jeffrey Corn - School child aged 8 Linda Corn - School child aged 5 Thanks to the Forestry Commission at Lyndhurst for information on Deer Research and Forestry.
